author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: My wife and I r innocent. There is proof. There is proof tht the detectives and CPS did not do their jobs. There is proof DA Hamilton along with the judge knew there was no evidence of anything they claimed. There is proof the doctor lied and it was the hospital tht hurt our son

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: A doctor lied, CPS and detectives testified to not even investigating. Tht they “felt” my wife was guilty. So y were we both charged and arrested then? Wht about my re-indictment? Just to dismiss my case after my wife is wrongfully convicted. Is tht justice? @moodyforelpaso

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: My case gets dismissed not once but twice. Wht about my due process? I didn’t get a trial. I didn’t get a chance to prove my innocence. All I got was a messed up background, lost my son, and my family torn apart. Our lives ruined. @moodyforelpaso @RDunhamDPIC @innocence

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: @moodyforelpaso @innocencetexas @RDunhamDPIC @innocence @TexasVsMelissa @freemellucio @TxCourts @ACLUTx @elpasotimes @leachfortexas @TexasBarCLE @TXCivilRights @TexasCJE @statebaroftexas so if DA Hamilton re-indicted me and says I can go to trial with my wife; Whts this? https://t.co/vcSEo15r2b

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: DA Hamilton is quoted saying, “he can go to trial with her.” Reference was to my wife and co-defendant.

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: No new charges no changes. Just a new case number and new judge. I wasn’t arrested or didn’t even have a warrant. I was told by the court appointed attorney tht I would b booked in and bailed out. Nothing happened. I was back on probation & he’s my court appointed attorney again

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: April 20, 2005 I’m re-indicted bcuz I failed to heed DA Hamiltons admonishment. Her warning. And how is it ok for my former court appointed attorney to call me with messages from the DA? I hadn’t spoken with him for 5 months.

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: @moodyforelpaso @innocencetexas @RDunhamDPIC @innocence @freemellucio @TexasVsMelissa @TxCourts @ACLUTx @elpasotimes @leachfortexas @TexasBarCLE @TXCivilRights @statebaroftexas is tht justice? A DA can indict someone to keep them from testifying? 2003 - 2008.

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: When DA Hamilton dismissed my case I was no longer a defendant. I was a witness for my wife. When DA Hamilton found out I was going to testify for my wife, she re-indicted me for “not butting out.” DA Hamilton abused her power to obstruct Justice and threatened a witness.

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: 1. Wht proof did DA Hamilton have to assume I was telling my wife anything about the plea? My wife and I both agree tht the innocent do not plea. 2. My wife and I were charged and arrested for the same thing. We were fighting together. For our family. How is tht a crime?

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: November 24, 2004 DA Hamilton dismissed my charges. Then it says I was advising my wife not to take the plea agreement with DA Hamilton. Tht I was admonished by both my public defender and DA Hamilton not to involve myself in my wife’s affairs.

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: 1,651 days. 54 months. Is tht how long it takes to get a trial in Texas? Y would my court appointed attorneys tell me tht the case was not about me but about my wife? She did nothing wrong. We were both charged and arrested for the same thing. @moodyforelpaso @RDunhamDPIC

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: It reads tht a warrant was issued on November 16, 2003 commanding my arrest. We were not arrested until December 2, 2003. From 2003 - 2008 waiting for trial and demanding my speedy trial. I was ignored by all my court appointed attorneys. My 6th amendment was violated.

author: Alfonso Dozal ♌️⚖️
text: Now y would the DA offer my wife a plea deal thru my court appointed attorney? Shouldn’t I get my own plea deal? If my wife takes the deal DA Hamilton will dismiss my case? I don’t think Thts how plea deals work. So much pressure on my wife to take blame for something; No?
